plethora.core
Class Ple_Agent

java.lang.Object
  plethora.core.Ple_Agent

public class Ple_Agent
extends java.lang.Object

This is an Agent Class. It works based on steering behaviors by Craig Reynolds implemented by Daniel Shiffman and Karsten Schmidt and vector movements inspired Langton's Ant. The Class uses toxiclibs, so please make sure you have toxiclibs installed. Check the example folder for more documentation. The class works with the Ple_Terrain class, allowing terrain evaluation. Written my Jose Sanchez - 2011 for feedback please contact me at: jomasan@gmail.com

Author:
jomasan

Constructor Detail

Ple_Agent

public Ple_Agent(PApplet _p5,
                 Vec3D _loc)
Basic constructor. Provide the PApplet refernce. (type 'this'). and the initial location of the agent. By default agents will start without any initial velocity.

Parameters:
_p5 -
_loc -
Method Detail

update

public void update()
Method to update location. Addes the acceleration (acc) to the velocity which gets passed to the location. The movement has momentum based on the acumulated velocity. Also has a maxspeed Value, that can be changed with the getter and setter methods.

flatten

public void flatten(float zValue)
Allow to make2D. Will collapse the z values of the locations to the value provided.

Parameters:
zValue - - Value for location z.

flatVel

public void flatVel()

updateSimple

public void updateSimple()
Method to update the location only by adding the velocity to the location. This simple update allows for more 'mechanical' movements, not having the momentum of acceleration.

dropAnchor

public void dropAnchor(Vec3D where)
This method allows for dropping a node that will stay static in the space and generate a spring connection to the agent. This will lock the agent to a distance to the anchor node based on the strength of the spring. You can decide to show the connection or not based on the final 'show' boolean. mass and gravity values are set by default.

Parameters:
stiffness - - Defines the stiffness of the spring
damping - - Defines the damping of the spring, smaller = more loose. (try 0.5);
threshold - - allows to give a range of action. Will not activate the spring if the distance from the agent to the anchor is bigger that the threshold.
show - - Allows to turn on and off the line between the agent and the anchor.

updateAnchor

public void updateAnchor(float stiffness,
                         float damping,
                         float threshold,
                         boolean show)

customWalk

public void customWalk(float angle1,
                       float angle2,
                       float chance1,
                       float chance2)
This method allos to generate a random rotation of the velocity in the angles specified. This will happen in a probability specified by the chance1 and chance2 methods. The method will calculate a value from 0 to 100, if the value is from 0 to chance1, will rotate the velocity by angle1, if the value is between chance1 and chance2, it will rotate velocity by angle2. Else velocity will state the same. This method can create interesting geometrical patterns while mantaining some of the goals of a steering behaivior.

Parameters:
angle1 - - first angle of rotation activated if random value is between 0 and chance1.
angle2 - - second angle of rotation activated if random value is between chance1 and chance2
chance1 - - chance threshold 01.
chance2 - - chance threshold 02

setFree

public void setFree()
This method will release the anchor. NOT YET IMPLEMENTED

drawTrail

public void drawTrail(float thresh)
This method will draw the Trail if the dropTrail method is activated. Make sure to have a trail to draw!

Parameters:
thresh - - this threshold allows for not drawing the lines longer than certain distance. Useful when using a wrapparound space border.

AlignmentCall

public void AlignmentCall(java.util.ArrayList<Ple_Agent> boids,
                          float desAli,
                          float aliScale)
This method allows to call the Alignment function. Define the population of agents to work with, the distance of evaluation and the scale of the force of separation. Based on Craig Reynolds flocking algorithm.

Parameters:
boids -
desAli -
aliScale -
